# *Monocystis*
>- Phylum: Apicomplexa
>- Class: Gregarinomorphea ("classical gregarines")
>- Studied since ~1900
>- Considered an examplar parasite of the gregarines

 \begin{picture}(250,250)
 \put(50,60){\includegraphics[height=6cm]{Monocystis.jpg}}
 \put(50,50){\begin{minipage}[t]{1\linewidth}
 \end{minipage}}
 \end{picture}
 
# *Monocystis* sp. in *Amynthas agrestis*
 >- *A. agrestis* colloquially known as the "crazy snake worm"
 >- earthworm has annual life cycle (early April - early November)
 >- putatively transmitted horizontally 
 
 \begin{picture}(250,250)
 \put(50,60){\includegraphics[height=6cm]{Amynthas.jpg}}
 \put(50,50){\begin{minipage}[t]{1\linewidth}
 \end{minipage}}
 \end{picture}
 
 
 
 
# Life History Questions and hypotheses
 
 \begin{itemize}
  \item{What is the phenology of the parasite and does the phenology differ between two sites?}
    \begin{itemize}
      \item{H0: The phenology of the parasite at HF and AU is not different}
      \item{HA: The phenology of the parasite at HF and AU is different}
    \end{itemize}
  \item{What is the life history of the parasite (sporocysts/gametocyst) and does this vary between sites?}
    \begin{itemize}
      \item{H0: There is no difference in sporocysts/gametocyst between sites}
      \item{HA: There is a difference in sporocysts/gametocyst between sites}
    \end{itemize}
  \end{itemize}
  
    

 
# Study Sites

 \begin{picture}(250,250)
 \put(70,10){\includegraphics[height=5cm]{Sites.jpg}}
 \put(0,230){\begin{minipage}[t]{1\linewidth}
  \begin{itemize}
    \item{Earthworms from each site collected every week from April 6, 2015 - November 10, 2015}
      \begin{itemize}
        \item{University of Vermont Horticultural Research and Education Center (Hort Farm, or HF)}
        \item{Centennial Woods Natural Area (CW)}
        \item{Green Mountain Audubon Center (AU)}
      \end{itemize}
    \end{itemize}
 \end{minipage}}
 \end{picture}


# Methods - Phenology and Measuring Parasitemia
>- 10 worms/site dissected each week
>- infection status determined (infected, not infected)
>- Counted # parasites/1uL homogenized seminal vesicle
>- Total parasitemia = parasites/1uL x total volume seminal vesicle (uL)

# Methods - Selecting a Life History Trait
>- Life history trait: sporocysts/gametocyst
>- gametocyst formed from mating of two parasites
>- gametocyst contains variable number of sporocysts
>- 1 sporocyst gives rise to 8 parasites capable of establishing infection
>- sporocysts/gametocyst can be used as estimate of reproductive output

\begin{picture}(200,250)
 \put(60,115){\includegraphics[height=5cm]{Gametocyst.jpg}}
 \end{picture}


# Methods - Measuring Sporocysts/Gametocyst
>- 10 earthworm infections per site
>- Images of 30 gametocysts/earthworm
>- Determined # sporocysts/gametocyst 
>- Total = 600 gametocysts counted

 \begin{picture}(250,250)
 \put(50,70){\includegraphics[height=6cm]{CountSpor.jpg}}
 \put(80,50){\begin{minipage}[t]{1\linewidth}
 \end{minipage}}
 \end{picture}

# Analysis - Life History Traits
\begin{minipage}[t]{1\linewidth}
  \begin{itemize}
    \item{Conducted Shapiro-Wilk Normality Test on counts for HF and AU}
    \item{Nested ANOVA}
      \begin{itemize}
        \item{Groups: Sites (HF and AU)}
        \item{Subgroups: individuals}
      \end{itemize}
    \end{itemize}
  \end{minipage}


# Parasite Phenology Results
 \begin{picture}(250,250)
 \put(-90,0){\includegraphics[height=9cm]{Parasitemia.jpeg}}
 \put(50,50){\begin{minipage}[t]{1\linewidth}
 \end{minipage}}
 \end{picture}
 
# Parasite Phenology Results
>- AU and CW same phenology (weeks 16-32)
>- HF has shorter season (weeks 20-32)
>- Week 33 was a hard-freeze at all sites and killed all worms

# Sporocysts/Gametocyst Results

# Normality Results
 \begin{picture}(250,250)
 \put(-15,10){\includegraphics[height=6cm]{HFHist.jpeg}}
 \put(150,10){\includegraphics[height=6cm]{AUHist.jpeg}}

    \item{Shapiro-Wilk Normality Test Results}

# Nested ANOVA 

 \begin{picture}(250,250)
 \put(30,5){\includegraphics[height=7cm]{Boxplot.jpeg}}
 \put(0,230){\begin{minipage}[t]{1\linewidth}
  \begin{itemize}
    \item{Nested ANOVA Results}
      \begin{itemize}
        \item{Site: F = 9.08, p-value = 0.0027}
        \item{Individual: F = 22.34, p-value = <2e-16}
      \end{itemize}
    \end{itemize}

 # Summary
 \begin{itemize}
  \item{Parasite phenology varies between sites}
    \begin{itemize}
      \item{AU and CW parasite season: weeks 16-32}
      \item{HF parasite season: weeks 20-32}
      \item{HF parasite season 2 weeks shorter, but earthworm season appears to be ~3 weeks longer at HF}
    \end{itemize}
  \item{Do life history traits (sporocysts/gametocyst) differ between sites?}
    \begin{itemize}
      \item{HF has a higher mean number of sporocysts/gametocyst than AU}
    \end{itemize}
  \end{itemize}

# Going forward
 \begin{itemize}
  \item{Determine if earthworm season differs between AU and HF}
    \begin{itemize}
      \item{3 years of soil temperature data for AU and HF}
      \item{5*C is when \textsl{A. agrestis} begin to hatch, and below freezing is when they die}
    \end{itemize}
  \item{What about Centennial Woods?}
    \begin{itemize}
      \item{CW did not produce gametocysts!}
      \item{How is CW maintaining the parasite?}
      \item{Possibly vertical transmission...}
    \end{itemize}
  \end{itemize}
